page.title: 01The Upper reaches Houndswood
page.content: The area stretches from the bottom of the eyewater valley to a high of 800ft on darks law. The prominent feature of the area large scale nature of the communications which run along the valley floor, following the river. the major settlement of the area is at Houndswood, which has recently been bypassed by the A1, and is centred round the church, built in 1831. The church spire is a significant focal point in the valley. The upper slopes of the area are cultivated for pasture,reaching to the plantations on the upper reaches. Fine views are seen to the south to the cheviots. The dominant feature in the moorlands in the north of the area is Press Castle an early 19th century castle, which was once the house belonging to the Estate, but in recent years has had to become subdivided into smaller
